hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following 10+ days of declining aggregate crypto market volume (<$40B daily average) AND BTC 20-day realized volatility dropping below 40%, the first day with >50% volume spike will trigger a directional move exceeding 3x the recent ATR(14) within 48 hours, with direction determined by whether price breaks above/below the 10-day consolidation range.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-liquidity-crash environments feature extended compression periods. When volume finally returns, it typically reflects new institutional positioning rather than noise. The magnitude of suppressed volatility creates explosive moves when liquidity re-enters.
entry_conditions: Single day volume spike >50% above 10-day average
BTC price breaks either above resistance or below support of 10-day range

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3x ATR(14) move in breakout direction OR volatility spikes to >60%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout fails and price returns to middle of consolidation range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volume spike occurs but price remains within 0.5x ATR of range, or breakout direction reverses within 24 hours.
